thread.title: Alberto, Rangers beat Blue Jays in 14th, lead ALDS 2-0
thread.title_full: Alberto, Rangers beat Blue Jays in 14th, lead ALDS 2-0

title: Alberto, Rangers beat Blue Jays in 14th, lead ALDS 2-0
text:
Updated: 5:56 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 | Posted: 5:56 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 Alberto, Rangers beat Blue Jays in 14th, lead ALDS 2-0 Related View Larger Toronto Blue Jays' catcher Russell Martin, left, attempts to tag Texas Rangers' Rougned Odor, right, who scores during the 14th inning of baseball Game 2 of the American League Division Series in Toronto, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT View Larger Texas Rangers' Rougned Odor, right, celebrates after scoring during the 14th inning of baseball Game 2 of the American League Division Series against the Toronto Blue Jays in Toronto, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT View Larger Members of the Texas Rangers and the Toronto Blue Jays meet on the field after both benches cleared during the 13th inning of Game 2 of the American League Division Series in Toronto, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Darren Calabrese/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT View Larger Toronto Blue Jays' Josh Donaldson leans on the rail in the dugout during the 11th inning of baseball Game 2 of the American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers in Toronto, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Sponsored Links The Associated Press TORONTO â€” 
Backup infielder Hanser Alberto singled home the go-ahead run in the 14th inning and the Texas Rangers beat the Toronto Blue Jays 6-4 Friday for a 2-0 lead in the best-of-five American League Division Series. 
The underdog Rangers will try to sweep the Blue Jays in Game 3 Sunday in Texas. Colby Lewis will start for Texas against Marco Estrada. 
Alberto, only in the lineup because star third baseman Adrian Beltre was out with a strained back, made an error that led to Toronto's first run. He delivered an RBI single with two outs in the 14th, and Delino DeShields followed with an infield hit for another run. 
Texas shut out the highest-scoring team in the majors after the fifth inning. The victory made road teams 5-0 in the postseason so far. 
Keone Kela (1-0) worked one inning for the win, staying calm after a dust-up with Toronto slugger Josh Donaldson. Ross Ohlendorf, with an old-school, double-armed windup, finished for a first save. LaTroy Hawkins (0-1) took the loss. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
